Class DiskUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • disk.DiskUtils

  • public class DiskUtils
extends java.lang.Object

      • powerOf2

        public static boolean powerOf2(int number)
        Determines if a given number is a power of 2.
        Parameters:
        number - the number to be analyzed
        Returns:
        true if number is a power of 2

      • copyIntToBlock

        public static void copyIntToBlock(VirtualDiskBlock vdb,
                                  int index,
                                  int value)
        Copy an integer value into four consecutive bytes in a block.
        Parameters:
        vdb - The block where the integer value is copied.
        index - The index of the first byte in the block that shall be written. The number is stored in four bytes whose indexes are: index, index+1, index+2, and index+3, starting from the less significant byte in the number up to the most significant.
        value - The integer value to be written in block.

      • getIntFromBlock

        public static int getIntFromBlock(VirtualDiskBlock vdb,
                                  int index)
        Extracts an integer value from four consecutive bytes in a block.
        Parameters:
        vdb - The block.
        index - The index in block of the less significant byte of the number to extract.
        Returns:
        The value extracted from bytes index+3, index+2, index+1, and index. From most significant to less significant bytes of the number's four bytes.

      • copyIntToBytesArray

        public static void copyIntToBytesArray(byte[] b,
                                       int index,
                                       int value)
        Copy an integer value into four consecutive bytes in an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        b - The array where the integer value is copied.
        index - The index of the first byte in the b that shall be written. The number is stored in four bytes whose indexes are: index, index+1, index+2, and index+3, starting from the less significant byte in the number up to the most * significant.
        value - The integer value to be written in the array.

      • getIntFromBytesArray

        public static int getIntFromBytesArray(byte[] b,
                                       int index)
        Extracts an integer value from four consecutive bytes in a byte[] array.
        Parameters:
        b - The array.
        index - The index in block of the less significant byte of the number to extract.
        Returns:
        The value extracted from bytes index+3, index+2, index+1, and index. From most significant to less significant bytes of the number's four bytes.

        index - the index to insert the Character at

        index - the index at which the Character is located
        Returns:
